raw_text:
Double win for Sea Inside
 
 Spanish movie The Sea Inside has been named best picture and star Javier Bardem best actor at the Bangkok International Film Festival.
 
 Based on the true story of a paralysed man's battle to end his life, The Sea Inside was best foreign language film at the 2005 Golden Globe Awards. Annette Bening and Ana Geislerova shared the best actress award at the Bangkok festival. This year's event was scaled down following the Asian tsunami disaster.
 
 Falling Down and The Phantom of the Opera director Joel Schumacher won a lifetime achievement award while Hong Kong director Wong Kar-Wai was honoured for promoting Asian cinema. "It's a great honour, I want to share this honour with my Thai colleagues," Wong said. French writer Christophe Barratie and Korean writer Park Chan-Chook shared the best screenplay award for Les Choristes and Old Boy respectively. Now in its third year, the Bangkok International Film Festival is donating profits from ticket sales to the tsunami relief fund.
llama3.2:1b: Spanish movie The Sea Inside wins Best Picture at Bangkok International Film Festival; Javier Bardem receives Best Actor award. It also won Best Foreign Language Film at Golden Globes and had Annette Bening and Ana Geislerova share Best Actress award. This year's festival reduced in scale due to the 2005 Asian tsunami disaster; event now donates profits to tsunami relief fund.

Joel Schumacher received a lifetime achievement award, and Hong Kong director Wong Kar-Wai was honored for promoting Asian cinema. The festival also saw wins for French writer Christophe Barratie and Korean writer Park Chan-Chook, as well as the donation of profits to tsunami relief efforts.

This year's festival was scaled back due to an Asian tsunami disaster, and it continues its tradition of giving a portion of revenue from ticket sales to the relief fund.

smollm:1.7b:
The Sea Inside was a Spanish movie that won the Best Picture at the 2005 Golden Globe Awards. Based on the true story of a paralysed man's battle to end his life, The Sea Inside was also best foreign language film at the 2005 Golden Globe Awards. Annette Bening and Ana Geislerova shared the Best Actress award at the Bangkok International Film Festival this year.

The movie is about a paralysed man who becomes obsessed with swimming in the ocean, hoping to find a way to end his life. The film was directed by Joel Schumacher and produced by Michael J. Phelps. The Phantom of the Opera director Joel Schumacher won the Best Actor award for his performance as the titular character.

The movie is based on the true story of a man who became paralyzed after being hit by a car in 1982. Despite this, he continued to swim and eventually made it to the top of a mountain, where he died. The film was inspired by the true story of a paralysed man named John Nash, who also swam to the top of a mountain before dying.

The movie won several awards at the 2005 Golden Globe Awards, including Best Foreign Language Film and Best Actress for Ana Geislerova. It is also a great honour to share this award with my Thai colleagues. The film was directed by Joel Schumacher and produced by Michael J. Phelps.

tinyllama:1.1b: A Spanish movie The Sea Inside has been crowned best picture at the Bangkook International Film Festival. In addition, Javier Bardem won the Best Actor award and Annette Bening shared the Best Actress honor with Ana Geislerova for their role in the film. Directors Joe Schumacher (Falling Down) and Wong Kar-Wai were honored with lifetime achievement awards, while Hong Kong director Woong Chan Sang received the Best Screenplay honor for Les Choristes and Old Boy. The Bangkook International Film Festival had originally planned to hold their event after the Asian tsunami disaster, but rescheduled it following a reduction in staff due to the emergency. This year's festival also awarded funds from ticket sales to relief efforts for victims of the disaster.
tinydolphin:1.1b: The Sea Inside (Spanish: El Señor de los Cielos) is a 2004 British-French psychological thriller film directed by Alejandro Amenábar and starring Javier Bardem as the title character, a paralysed man who becomes embroiled in the political struggle surrounding a murder. The Sea Inside has been awarded best picture at the Bangkok International Film Festival, best foreign language film at the 2005 Golden Globe Awards, and has garnered several awards and nominations, including Best Foreign Language Film at the 74th Academy Awards. In addition to being a critically acclaimed work of both cinema and literature, The Sea Inside was released in the United States on November 13, 2005, by Miramax Films.
